Pre-Game Insights: Lithuania needed a two-legged victory over Gibraltar to remain in League C, following a respectable past 12 months.
Lithuania finished fourth in their Euro 2024 qualifying section, beating Bulgaria and holding Hungary and Montenegro to draws.
Lithuania lost narrowly in the Baltic Cup final to Estonia after defeating Latvia in the semi-finals.
Cyprus lost all eight Euro 2024 qualifier matches with a goal difference of minus-25, and also lost to Moldova 4-1 in June.
Cyprus has failed to win a competitive away match since 2019 against Kazakhstan, losing 14 of the 17 since.
Manager Temuri Ketsbaia is under increasing pressure in Cyprus, having won just four of his 18 games in charge.
Post-Match Reflections: Lithuania had their struggles in the last Nations League campaign but should come into this break slightly rejuvenated after recent wins over Gibraltar and in the Baltic Cup.

Cyprus won their last international fixture, but that was to be expected against San Marino, and if manager Ketsbaia fails to end their five-year wait for an away competitive win, the pressure on him will mount.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Lithuania left out their two most experienced players, Arvydas Novikovas and Fedor Cernych, for their upcoming matches.
Cyprus has not won a competitive away match since 2019 against Kazakhstan.
